alert.note: Alert for Bastrop (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 8:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: .Heavy rainfall rates of 1-2" per hour are occurring. Many roadways are covered with water and some culverts have begun to overflow. Motorists will need to take it slow and avoid water-covered roadways. Rain will slowly exit the region in the next 1-2 hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Lee, Travis and Williamson. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 758 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Austin, Round Rock, Georgetown, Pflugerville, Taylor, Elgin, Bastrop, Smithville, Granger, Lexington, Windemere, Austin Bergstrom Int Airport, Hutto, Manor, West Lake Hills, Bartlett, Rollingwood, Mustang Ridge, Thrall and Weir. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
